alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 5:51PM EDT until July 05 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL HANCOCK AND SOUTH CENTRAL PENOBSCOT COUNTIES... At 551 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Grand Falls, or 19 miles southeast of Lincoln, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Grand Falls, Great Pond and Greenfield. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
